She did an AMAZING job on my hair and I'm so glad I let her get me to try something different for the summer. I highly recommend her for your highlight needs!

VEGAN TOPPINGS?! Count me in!!!

My bf & I have been on the hunt for vegan friendly pizza places whenever we're craving some pizza. We tried Pieology but weren't satisfied and luckily I ran upon all the reviews saying that this place had vegan toppings including cheese and meats (chicken and sausage) which was a deal breaker! 

It's only $7.99 for a 12 inch pizza and you get the choice of unlimited toppings. For just $2 extra, the vegan toppings are automatically added to your pizza - such a great deal! We covered it with a bunch of veggies and the pizza was absolutely delicious! 

The sauces (except alfredo and the pestos) are all vegan as well as their choice of crusts (Traditional, Wheat, and Gluten Free). 

There's also plenty of seating in the restaurant and love how it has a "homey kitchen" vibe ambiance, just as the name entails. 

We were super happy and will definitely be back soon whenever we need a pizza fix!

If I was only rating the food, it would be 5 stars. Everything tasted fresh and yummy. 

The restaurant itself, however, is very dirty. From the bathrooms to the menus, there is a layer of grease/filth on everything. Before the food came out, I made a point to wash my hands again and not touch the menu, the seats or the table so I don't get it on my hands. 

The service was mediocre at best. Our server constantly leaned over our food and table and we even had to send back a bowl of rice because his dirty shirt went in it. When we asked for anything extra, it seemed like we were an inconvenience and the server wouldn't even answer. 

Maybe it's just me, but when I see a place this dirty, I don't want to come back. It just makes me picture how nasty the kitchen must be. 

I will definitely not be back.

Perhaps the most disappointing consumer experience of my life. If I could leave a zero, I would. So much for the customer being right. Clearly, Jesse could not care less about me as a new customer that could have spent quite a sum of money in their store.

As a beginner player, I picked up a used racket on Saturday for my first lesson on Monday. At that point, Pam was great and made a few recommendations and I chose a racket to start. After a dozen balls on Monday evening, the instructor recommended that I move to a lighter racket. The instructor actually goes to the store on Tuesday afternoon and locates a lighter racket that may work. I speak with the instructor on the way to the store and we determine perhaps a better investment at this time may be a good quality pair of shoes and that we revisit the racquet purchase in a couple of weeks. 

I didn't think asking for a store credit in the amount equal to the amount paid for the racket would be an issue. I couldn't have been more wrong! When I arrived at the store, I introduced myself to Jesse and shook his hand. I explained that I would prefer to return the racket for a store credit towards shoes. He said that my instructor picked out a racket and he was not interested in giving me a store credit towards new shoes. His attitude towards me was quite angry.

After another failed attempt to get him to provide a credit towards new shoes I replied, OK, I will take the replacement racket and buy my shoes elsewhere. He then responded by putting the returned racket back up on the counter and saying how 'bout I do this? In other words, take the old racket back. I once again confirmed that he was not willing to provide a credit towards new shoes and his demeanor got much worse. It was at that point I said do the exchange for the replacement racket and I will be on my way. All of this with other patrons in the store hearing and observing the exchange.

To think I could have such a positive experience on Saturday with Pam who helped in every way possible and turn around a few days later and have this experience with Jesse basically supports every negative story about this store that I have heard from other tennis players in the area. I thought I would give them a try and make my own assessment. 

In closing, this store no longer exists in my mind. For Jesse to respond in such a juvenile and unprofessional manner was completely out of line. 

I will never recommend this store to anyone!

Tasty, but too expensive. 

The girl who took my order was really nice and poured me a glass water even though I was taking out. I would say great service, but the time it actually took to make the sundae was surprising (more on this).

I ordered The Sumner Night. I love mango and have tried various Asian mango frozen treats along Yonge. As I got my order I was shocked at the size o.o when she handed it to me. It took all that time for this? It was meager in proportion and offensive! I payed $9.05 for a cup of mango ice cream, mango bits and cornflakes (on the bottom and got very soggy). If you want to compare, think of grande sized cup from Starbucks and then to add further insult do not fill it to the top of the cup. It was basically one scoop of ice cream with other bits in a cup!!! 

There are a ton off other offerings with way way way way way better value. I thought Sweet O clock was a bit pricey, but you get way more for the same price and better quality.

Skip Sugar Bay and keep walking.

The greatest employees of all time. Always friendly, smiling and working hard!! Always greeted upon entry by the entire staff and my food is always handled with care. Couldn't be a better set of employees.
My friend and I went there last week to try it for the first time. We really didn't like it and the service was horrible.

You offered to fix it when you knew that we hauled it away to another city.  If you really wanted to help, you would offer a more reasonable solution.  You already charged me $300 for an unfixed problem.  Why would I come all the way back?
Great customer service and the food is very satisfying  definitely couldn't finish my burger nachos, love the ambience definitely relaxing and chill.
Great food and service! Wonderful happy hour. My wife and I enjoy the atmosphere and surroundings. Its a place we like to just to feel comfortable and relaxed.

Great burgers!  Totally reminds me of my time living in New York.  I used to hit the shake shack in Grand central station at least twice a week. 
Great place!!
Food was delicious, service was a little slow but the staff was super friendly. The soda was very watery though.

I can't get enough of this place! You may take a look at the menu and think that it's a tad pricey as I did, but don't be fooled - you get A LOT of deep fried porky goodness for what you pay! I've tried almost all of their sauces, and I'm torn between the original... and everything else. The best way to go about it is to go with a bunch of other (non germaphobic) people and just dip your pork into their plates. I recommend the pork tender, but several of my friends can't tell the different between the loin (cheapest and bigger) and the tender. I've also tried some of their appetizers, which are good but I don't remember what they were because THE KATSU. BASICALLY WHAT I AM SAYING IS if you like katsu please come here and get almost anything and you will be happy. Unless you're from Japan, in which case you'll at least be content. Kthxbye.

I've been here several times.  The food is always spot on.  Tonite I had a problem with our waitress Gabrielle.  We were a table of 50 something ladies - I can vouch for all the ladies seated we are generous tippers when it comes to great service.  This evening's service was very sub standard.  I'm hoping she was a waitress-in-training.  We had to go to the bar to ask for mayonnaise for a sandwich, a fresh cup of coffee, refill on bar drinks and never checked back after being served in a timely manner.  However, she did have time to chat with a neighboring table of 20-somethings and dote on their needs.  Step up to the plate young adults under 30 that wait on tables.....you would have made $30 on our table but instead chose to take home only $5 because of poor service.

Fast friendly service ! Ask for Franz, he's a great sales rep!! He's professional and pretty quick with everything ! Hate the car buying process but he made it pretty painless!!  I'll be buying from CarMax again in the future!!

I first used Hannah for my toddler when he was around 18m and we were having trouble going from two naps to one. She easily fixed our problem with a few minor tweaks. Then I had my second child who in my mind was the worst sleeper ever. He would wake up multiple times during nap, multiple times at night, and I would have to rock him for an hour to even get him to sleep in the first place. I knew sleep training was hard though and I kept making up excuses on why I didn't want to do it yet. Come seven months later and I was going crazy with a kid who never slept and was always overtired. So I enlisted the help oh Hannah once again. She ensured me that we would have him sleeping in no time and I almost didn't believe her... I mean I can't get him to sleep in under an hour there was no way he was going to sleep on his own. I defiantly had my doubts and if it did work I figured I would be spending my nights listening to him cry and I would probably be crying too. I remember a few days before we started I went and read all Hannah's reviews because surely none of the kids she helped were as bad as mine. Wrong! I loved reading all the success stories and picked a date. The first night he cried 20min, the next nap 9 min and pretty much from then on he was falling asleep completely on his own with no crying. I was shocked!!!!!! In less than 24hrs my horrible sleeper was falling asleep on his own and staying asleep. I'm still in shock. I paid for the week of texting which was amazing, anytime I had an inclining of doubt in the program Hannah was there to encourage me. Within one week my horrible sleeper was sleeping 12hrs at night and napping 3-4hrs during the day. I finally can take a shower in the morning, I started eating breakfast again, and I even get to talk to my hubby at night!  I still can't believe it, and I REALLY wish I did it sooner. My entire family is happier now that we all get our rest. Hannah is so amazing- I just can't say enough about her program and most importantly that it actually works.

The food here is mediocre, overpriced, and portions are extremely small. I tried the duck wings, ox tongue, and grilled octopus. I was hyped up by our server because these dishes supposedly tasted the best, but was quickly disappointed. 

Service was great and the restaurant is very nice.

Had a very nice meal here with my son and daughter in law.  The food is very good, and on our visit the service was excellent, with the waiter and sommelier both very knowledgeable and helpful.  We were very happy with the recommended food choices, and the sommelier made an excellent choice that was within the price range I indicated.  We splurged afterwards with a glass of very old port that was also delicious.
Everything here is perfect. Escargot is life.

We were there to see a performance of  Vegas, The Show. The performance was old school Vegas entertainment and I recommend you take it in. It evokes the great acts from the 40's to the 90's. This is an ensemble performance with a dozen or so terrific performers in the ensemble and a first class orchestra. 

I do not think there are any bad seats in the house so you do not need the more expensive tickets. You can buy a dinner/performance package but that will not likely actually save you any money. 

The theater has comfortable seats, good sound and all the seats seem to have a great view. There is a bar in the waiting lounge and bar service in the theater before the performance starts. 

The staff were helpful when asked for help. 

The lounge area and bar are dark and  on the edge of shabby. They need work and pulled down our expectations for the performance.

Good ramen, great (and adorable!!) atmosphere. This ramen place is in an old house with inside seating, and a lovely outdoor patio. Unfortunately I don't have a photo of the bowl of ramen as it was too dark, but I was happy with it. I had the tonkotsu ramen with pork belly - the broth was thick and flavorful, noodles were good, the egg was prepared and seasoned well. The seaweed appetizer was surprisingly good and unusual with the addition of tasty shiitake mushrooms. One thing that I didn't really enjoy was the spring roll appetizer which was rather bland.

This is a great find for a city this size and its relatively new which is always a plus. The attached parking garage that leads directly to your room floor is very handy and secured with key cards and worth $9 a day without a doubt. Cannot beat my rate on a slow week...$115 for a double queen room and a very modern bathroom with very nice fixtures...close to luxury hotel room quality. 

Are you going to have a Zen moment here...probably not given its a limited service hotel...but what more can you expect at this rate. What you get is a comfortable convienent effecient place in a nice neighborhood with lots of dining choices just around the corner.

Had to laugh when reading a few reviews..."the maid barely knocked then barged in and almost saw me naked" ... too funny...ever heard of locking your door like when you are at home to keep strangers out? Or "the hotel employee guy in the breakfast area nearly talked my leg off and I couldnt get rid of him"...how about just telling him you are trying to concentrate on figuring out where you are going to fill your pie hole next later that day...that ought to work. How about taking some personal responsibility for your life rather than blaming everyone else for your issues...really. This is a great place and CU is lucky to have it...plain and simple. Give it a try...no kidding!

Extraordinary customer service from Rachel, who scheduled a same day appointment for a home rekey, to Zach the locksmith!  Family operated business, and their service excellence displays their "pride of ownership".  Will recommend them and ZACH whenever anyone needs a great locksmith company.
Came in on a very slow night, service and food were just okay! Got the Mac and cheese burger was too much bun and the patty was pretty dry.
Nice staff but just an overall mediocre job. Lines for my French manicure are crooked and gel polish all over my skin. Bummer.

Recently replaced all the windows on my ranch home in Scottsdale built in 1986 that still had the original metal frame single pane glass. This was the first phase of some extensive renovation to include a new roof and full repainting of the exterior.  Brian from Wholesale Windows and Doors came out and explained everything up front and answered any questions we had.  I checked the reviews of the brand of windows they represented and found them to be rated in the upper quartile and the bid was very competitively priced.  Brian assigned their best crew to do the job.  They were great guys, did exceptional work with a lot of attention to detail and completed the job on time. The entire experience was seamless.  I would not hesitate at all recommending in the future.

This place wasn't my favorite. To be fair, I was with a large group and we all shared a bunch of food and I probably would have liked it better if I was able to order my own dishes that I liked. Everyone else liked the food and it did seem good/fresh. I just can't give it a high score because I simply didn't like the dishes (not my taste, not that they were bad). Clean restaurant, nice servers.

What a great bar/restaurant! Went in on Saturday afternoon and sat at the bar for a couple of drinks and lunch. Ordered the chopped salad, IPA bacon and carnitas tacos. Wow! The tortillas they used are thin and cooked perfectly, bacon was sweet and the salad was huge! Natasha, one of the owners, was also our bartender and was such a delight. Can't wait to go back!

4 stars for Mariko and the concept...but honestly I woulda given this one more around 3.5 stars.... I knowwww!?! but I was spoiled rotten and the bar was just too high for Sports de Combat to quite reach. That being said, i still had a lot of fun and so did my +1 and I would consider coming back ... 

Things that were awesome: So many activities all under one roof! Easy to find building, decent location and size. Freezies on site. Yah that rawked! I loved getting a bullseye with a bow and real arrow!! I loved hanging out with my fellow Yelpers and meeting their guests!

Things that kinda irked me: 

Poorly organized by the place's staff...one guy kinda took the lead and explained the activities and how to go about participating, but he did so with his back to half the crowd so most of us were clueless as to where to go and ended up missing chances to participate in certain things. Each staff was clearly identified to which activity they would oversee tho and they each did a good job of explaining the activity...but they seemed like they were winging the organization of it all quite a bit. 

The Rage room was reserved for the winner of the contests at the bow n arrow and axe throwing activities: which was not me, so I didn't get to smash stuff booooo. 

We never saw the Puzzle room? Or at least I didn't. 

The axes weren't fabu (dull, small n weird lookin), but it was fun throwing them, despite not a single one sticking into the wood (almost got one but it fell out a second later).

Their version of dodgebow ("archery combat" as it's called here) was small, cramped, took wayyyy too long to explain (especially for those of us who went to Dodgebow) and was wayyy too short, also their helmets are suffocating and the "field" is very cramped and tiny. 

And .. I didn't get to nerf battle. (Aforementioned organization issue). I was lookin forward to that. 

So yah great potential...love that there was all that under one roof. The staff are super sweet and friendly. They have a buncha awesome stuff to smash if u do try the Rage room. 

And otherwise all 4 stars go to Mariko and Yelp for getting us this kool opportunity and Mariko again for bringing us pizza and cheese !!!! Such a great snack with such great ppl! Thanks againnnnnnn!!!!!!

Great place!  I visited thevCrown and Dragon for the first time last Sunday, after having the place highly recommended to me by friends.  They were so right!  This pub is nice and casual, with a friendly vibe.  My friends and I enjoyed sitting on the patio, and we made great use of the Sunday half price wing deal.  We ended up having 8 lbs of wings, which definitely took care of our hunger pangs, and at a GREAT price.  We chose both the Original Buffalo and Dragon's Breath sauces, and liked both.  The Dragon's Breath is definitely hotter/spicier, but both were enjoyably hot without being overwhelming.

Special shout out to our server!  She was great!  Very attentive, and seemed to actually anticipate when we needed something, and was right on it.

Had a great experience, and will definitely be back soon!

My fiance and I ordered cheesecake factory through door dash. I ordered the Evelyns favorite pasta. When I went in for my second bite I noticed a long black hair in my food. So disgusting. I called cheesecake factory to let them know and they said they couldn't do anything for me because I ordered through door dash. A hair in my food is not a result of door dash. It's a result of improper hygiene in their kitchen. I will not be ordering cheesecake factory again after the experience I had. Terrible customer service.

I had spent the whole afternoon calling around getting quotes before speaking with Joey at Five Star iPhone Repair and let me tell you - what a relief that was! Not only did he offer me the lowest prices, but he also arrived within the hour and had my phone repaired in less than 30 minutes! I was pleasantly surprised with the outcome and couldn't be happier with the work Joey did on my iPhone. I definitely would not hesitate before calling him again to complete any repairs I may need done in the future. So, save yourself the time and hassle and just go to fivestarlv.com to book your appointment. You won't be disappointed!
I always get meaty ribs when I come here until tonight. It was no problem, they replaced with super meaty ones and a couple extra to boot! Thanks Famous Dave's!

The Duke is amazing.  I dream about it.   Pulled pork on top of waffle fries with sauce and some other dressing.  Small place in strip mall.  Not many tables so be prepared to possibly wait a little during the lunch rush.
David answered my call and came to my in under an hour. Made a key with a chip in it in and finished in 20 min. Awesome man. Cheap and quick! Highly recommended!!

My new favorite pizza spot! We decided to give this place a try after reading multiple 5 star reviews. They definitely live up to their reviews. Great fresh pizza and amazing customer service.  Lots of toppings! We ordered a large veggie pizza and an order of the hot wings. Neither disappointed. We drove 30 mins from Centennial Hills and it was more than worth it. Can't wait to come back!

LOVE XOXO LOVE MJT!!

It's probably the closest thing to Seattle's Pike Place Market less fish.   This is used by mostly locals and few tourists.  

Next time I will stay nearby and start my trip  here.  I'll spend a whole day eating through and getting snacks for rest of my trip here!   

MJT  is located in Little Italy, originally settled by northern Italians and is a large produce/farmers market.  Around the perimeter, there are bakeries, charcuteries, kitchen gadgets, caffe, ethnic grocers etc.  Within the market itself there is a small food court too with créperie, Indian foods, sausage/burger stand, desserts etc., but more than 70% are producers selling their goods everything from eggs, mushrooms, cheeses, jam, spices, fruits, flowers to meats.  There was one oyster bar that had at least 2 dozen different varieties (Next time - it was a little early in the day for a raw bar).  

++. Ambiance is easy outdoor strolling through an old fashioned market.  In winter, it's smaller and is enclosed.

+++ Products were fabulous!  Did you see all my pics of gorgeous veggies? They focus on local Quebec, not organics.  Lots of maple syrups and butters and cheese curds.    

+.  Service is mostly good.  This is not geared to tourists so keep in mind when you are shopping that they are going to focus on locals who buy here than at grocery stores.  

+.  Prices were cheaper than at Molina, a nearby Italian grocer on produces but not on cheese and meats.  Most take credit cards and cash is welcomed.

-  Parking is tight and is street metered.  Might be best to lyft/Uber or park a few blocks away (still metered but easier) and walk.

I hate to do this because the people there were very nice. However! Last night was the first time going to Pizza Heaven. I have heard good things about it so I figured I would give it a try. I ordered a pepperoni and sausage pizza and 10 hot wings to go. When I got to my car I took a couple bites of the pizza and was pretty disappointed. It had very little flavor, and the crust was to crispy with very little flavor. 
    After I got home I ate a couple more slices and ended up throwing the rest away. I then tried the wings. Disappointed again!! Extremely strong pepper flavor and very little sauce. It tasted like pepper flavored backed chicken. 
   The worst part about this was, this was a splurge for. I haven't been off my diet in a very long time. I guess I won't be going back to pizza heaven.

I loved it.

I just came back after spend nearly $230 and it was well worth it.  The clowns make the show - from the clown that gets hit with the hammer multiple times to the sinking boat.    The visuals will just take you away.  For me - what I also loved was the music..now I have to get the CD.  I was in row "O" and it perfect.  Now I want to see the other shows.

For over a year I have been plagued by pain in my outer thigh/hip that often leaves me limping while trying to walk around. The pain has encumbered my activities of mountain biking, climbing, running, and hiking. Scott was able to loosen whatever was causing the pain and I have been able to complete a two day backpacking trip with heavy packs and several mountain bike trips with no pain. I highly recommend Scott for therapeutic massage needs.

The best!!
So many beers on tap, best yam fries, and nicest staff
Overall atmosphere is really great too:)
My friend and I absolutely love it
We had MVPita delivered to our house with the request that they text up arrival- they were accommodating with the text and the food was so dang tasty! Love this place!

Worst chapel 'so-called' traditional Catholic ever been to. It's full of novus ordo novelties and Vatican II False teachings!  This chapel is not a true traditional Catholic one. I was being kind by giving one star!!

I wish I would have read some of the other reviews before trying to engage this outfit to consider buying my furniture.  I would give this no stars if that was an option.  DO NOT WASTE YOUR TIME with this company.  Not only is the individual who is responsible for reviewing the furniture rude, he does not follow through.  I spent a good week sending multiple emails with pics attached and trying to follow up to get a status, only to be told the emails were never received, (I received a confirm # each time I sent), and then, finally, when he did respond, he was rude and brusk and advised he would need to come out and review the furniture before he could offer a bid.   he set the time w a 3 hour window and then, he did not show up on the time he had scheduled to come to my home.   no call, no text ... he just blew me off.  WHO DOES BUSINESS LIKE THIS and has the balls to say they pay top dollar and are the best???   

I typically don't make comments on vendor service but this is the most unprofessional experience I have encountered and thought I should let others know, to save them the angst.  Maybe they are just too successful and don't need to provide good customer service or maybe they should just take the "we buy furniture" off their site, clearly, they don't or don't do it well !!

Food is really good,  like always. ..  We come here often but tonight is just an exemption.  We brought our niece from Italy for her birthday and to impress here of our food and service.  Like I said, food is phenomenal but absolutely no service at all.  We have to ask three different servers just for a bread.  Can't get no water and our main server had to ask the birthday girl if she wants a surprise dessert.   I thought its called a surprise.

I highly recommend this business for its fast and efficient services! I went in to get my fingerprints done and I didn't have to wait in a line. It was a quick process and I was out the door shortly after. Monica and her staff were very friendly and I'll be sure to return whenever I need something notarized.

Excellent dollar tacos on Tuesday, el pastor was the best of what we tried then the chicken. One of the Salas's was full of onions and extra spicy, unsure why it was like that, but we liked it. Looks pretty nice inside and the staff and service was great

I wanted to like this place.  I did.  And I thought it could be a magic source of tasty ramen tucked away in crappy overpriced Vegas food.  It had the cramped no frills interior that I thought might translate into authentic ramen.  But it wasn't good.  I eat at the crappy ramen places so you don't have to--skip this one.  Noodles were sub par.  Broth was weak.  Egg was way over cooked.  Sorry, still looking for good ramen in Vegas.  Stay tuned.

The hype is real!!! This place is crazy. Get here before 10am or you're going to be waiting a while. The feel is like a trucker stop collided with a diner that was owned by a modern interior designer. Make sure you go hungry because the portions are huge. Very easy for 2 adults to share a plate and not go away hungry. 

We ordered a snickers flap jack, and this thing was the size of a pizza. I thought the waitress was joking when she said it was the size of a Prius tire, but she wasn't. HUGE, and more surprising, no loss of flavor or quality. Great exterior with a nice, soft interior. 

I had some bacon and eggs, and they were as good as any I've ever had. Our friends ordered the house special (I forget the name) but it had a sage fried chicken, waffle, some crazy good sauce, mashed potatoes, and fried spaghetti. I stole half their plate and went into a food coma. Of course you can't forget about the BLT Bloody Mary. I'm not a Bloody Mary fan, but that may have converted me. 

Service was awesome, food was even better. We will definitely return next time in Vegas.

Very disappointed with are order today. My husband called in an order to be picked up. We ordered a large bogo wings and a small bogo wings.Sauces that we wanted were spicy garlic, Parmesan garlic, teriyaki,honey BBQ,  and desert heat.  When we opened all the boxes, most of are wings had no sauce. Like seriously!!! That's messed up,  just because it's a ToGo doesn't mean to half ASS it and not put sauce.  Never ordering from this bdubs again!!! My husband said it wasn't even busy when he picked up are order.
Had a poke bowl from here and it was downright delicious. It was my first time eating a poke bowl, and now I am completely addicted!

Thanks again! They saved me $100 on a new exhaust that I was going to order online, I will only buy parts through them now. 

Mary is awesome, great owner and great person.

Their donuts were served warm and when you take a bite they are a little crispy on the outside.So good! They have a lot of different flavors to offer. I had 3 and that was just enough. Also, had an iced latte with almond milk (one shot espresso) and that was good as well. Friendly staff and quick service. We got a dozen to take home and they are quick to make them.

This is a definite visit for beer and wine lovers!!  It's difficult to find great beer and wine selections that BOTH wine and beer lovers like and this place has it!!  It has a very cool vibe and has a front patio and back patio when the weather is nice enough to sit outside!  The menu is delicious and the staff is very attentive and friendly!  Three ladies started this amazing place and you should give it a try as you will not be disappointed!
The first time I ever had to get my money back for my bowl... too much cartilage and fat in the chicken... sooooo gross

The first time we dined in at Pinkys, service and burgers were off the chain. We went right before 5 o'clock traffic hit, so it wasn't really packed. We got seated promptly on the patio, which had lots of fans! Made good for having a local canned beer, at half price! I got the mammoth w/ pepper jack & American, my other half got a triple w/ everything.. our burgers were a little ridiculous, but the best ridiculous way. However I will say, their onion rings are not onion rings. They're onion straws! 

The other night I ordered through take out. Again, got the mammoth for the smoldering cheese but they put 2 kinds of the wrong cheese on my burger. I was pretty sad about it, but I will definitely be back for another dine in experience.
This place discriminates. Why the hell have store in south phoenix if you are not going to deliver to the people in SOUTH PHOENIX.? Bad customer service and bad ethics. This place sucks
i love weight watchers however i must say its pretty expensive for them not doing much.  I find besides them giving me the point system i do the rest myself

I came for dinner one night on my latest trip. I was staying nearby and their menu appealed to me. I got the cold shoulder immediately from the host. I was told there was a table but I only had an hour. Okay, fine, whatever. I'm used to the Montreal attitude, I just take it in stride by now. 

I am seated and the waiter was nice. I ordered a bottle of sparkling water but he really pushed me to buy alcohol. I said no but it was awkward. I got their salad special of the night which was a shaved fennel, beet, and grapefruit salad. It was quite refreshing and delicious.

Then I got the caprese pizza. For 18 dollars, I thought it was overpriced for what you got. Now I tend to eat a lot and I ate it all. So for two people, you might need 2 pizzas if you don't eat anything else. The crust is super thin and while that is kind of nice on the edge where it gets crispy, the center is very soggy and sloppy. It was mediocre pizza.
Love here! The vibes and the decor is very appealing. Hip with many beautiful and interesting patrons. Food is excellent and service impeccable

I was looking forward to coming here due to the really good reviews but I honestly just had an average experience. We got lucky and didn't have to wait in line to be seated so that was a plus. We ordered the chicken adobo fried rice and the red velvet pancakes. The fried rice was not as good as I was expecting. The rice was kind of hard and it just tasted like vinegar. The "adobo" flavor that I was looking for was close to non-existent. It came with a side of potatoes. The potatoes were extremely dry. At least the serving size was enough for at least two people. I also tried their red velvet pancakes. I thought it was okay as it was missing that kick of red velvet (if you had your eyes closed while eating, you'd probably think it was just a regular pancake." I understand that the restaurant is not that spacious but the tables are way too close to each other. I definitely came to this place with a really high expectation and I just let myself down. At least our server was pretty attentive to our needs.
Very good food and fast. Friendly staff. Great location with lots of pre/post dinner options.

This is one of the worst dining experiences I've had in a while. Literally, from the moment I arrived, it started to go down hill. And, just. Kept. Snowballing.

I was meeting friends for dinner at 630p for their promo of bottomless street tacos and margaritas for $25. I was a bit early, so I went to the bar for a drink. I explained to the bartender that I was meeting friends, but I was early. I ordered a Sangria. And, when she served it to me I tried to give her my card because I knew my dining companions were on their way, I knew I wouldn't be drinking a 2nd drink at the bar, and I knew it would slow things down to have to pay my bar tab when it was time to be seated. She refused and told me she'd start a tab. I said I didn't want to do that and again tried to hand her my card, but she told me it was no problem and walked away. But, it actually was a problem for me. When my friends arrived, I again tried to pay for my drink and after about 3 minutes of waiting at the bar and being unsuccessful, I gave up and joined my friends at our table. I mentioned my unpaid for drink to the hostess and our server. So, I made a strong effort to tell several employees.

We asked to be seated on the patio since it was a nice night. I initially thought it was closed since no one was sitting out there, but they told us it wasn't when we asked. And, after we were seated out there, other Diners followed suit. But, even this felt like it took time.

Once we were seated, we were given menus, and then we waited...and waited...and waited. It took FOREVER to get someone to come take our order. When the server finally did take our orders (there 6 of us). He then started retaking our orders. It was odd, but we laughed it off. We, also, asked to see a dessert menu at this time, which never came.

4 of the 6 ordered the bottomless special, and 2 of us ordered other items off the menu. The people who ordered the bottomless tacos tried to order what they felt like they wanted to start, for example 3 of each kind, but we're told they could only have 5 at a time. I get it, you don't want to leave the kitchen scrambling, but c'mon. AND...it made no difference since 2 of the 4 taco eaters were left with no food for at least 30 minutes. At no time did a manager or a server, or anyone else come by to apologise for or explain the delay. It turned out that those 2 diners had ordered al pastor tacos and the kitchen had run out and were making more. So you say nothing?? And, let half a party eat and half a party eat nothing?? Really??

I had ordered nachos which I 100% didn't eat. I didn't eat them because I had nothing to drink for at least 45 minutes to an hour. Nothing. I had ordered a 2nd Sangria and it just never came...partly because our server disappeared partly because when he did he told us they had sent people home and they were slammed. In the meantime, someone at our table who had not ordered a 2nd drink because they still had half of their 1st one, was given a 2nd drink...while I had nothing. Even my water glass was long empty by this time. Again, no one cared to ask if something was wrong with the nachos or inquire as to why they were sitting in front of me completely untouched.

In addition to the dessert menu that never came, was an order of chips and guacamole. No one ever offered dessert either. They did, however charge us for the chips & guacamole we never got. The server removed them from the bill, but questioned that we didn't get them. WHO did he think brought them?? Certainly not him. He was nowhere to be found!!

I feel bad blaming the server. I know that they're the face you see and when things are going wrong elsewhere in a restaurant, they get blamed. Clearly, there were failures all over this restaurant. The management should not have sent anyone home leaving the place short staffed, the kitchen wasn't prepared for week 2 of the bottomless taco promo, and if you are serving a bar full of people and running a bottomless margarita promo you need more than 1 bartender. I dine out often enough to understand this and none of us gave the server any flack. But, WHERE was anyone... our server, ANY server, A MANAGER to explain the unbelievably long delays and just say they were sorry for it. Our bill was over $150 for the 6 of us. There had to be someone available to say or do something to make up for it...yet no one came. And, that is why I won't be heading back to Casa del Matador. The food was OK, but the service/execution was horrendous.

Very good. Complex flavours. Not too pricey for the amount that you get. The most redeeming qualities about this place are: the conviviality of the owner/employees, the consistency in quality of the dish as you devour (doesn't get dry or bland), and how healthy and guilt-free you feel after the meal. My only issue with this place is that I may or may not have gotten mild food poisoning. It may have just been something else I ate, considering the friends I went with were fine. Overall, a cute spot.

I love Panda Express so I came to this one. I stood in line and there was one lady working that I could see. I was behind the person ordering their food. Then a man walks up to the glass in front of the food basically cutting me in line. The worker woman had looked at me multiple times already and knew my place in line but she served this random dude who just showed up. I had already been standing in line for a while at this point. I looked at both of them in amazement and the lady didn't even acknowledge me. So I walked away in frustration. Never coming here again.

This is for the Subway at the Monte Carlo. 10.50 got a foot long BMT? You have to be kidding. Can't even get a glass of water. Terrible service and the bread tastes old. You guys should at least wear masks and carry guns if you're going to rob people.
Delicious!!! Amazing burgers , awesome shakes, and the staff is always nice. Been here so many and never been disappointed.

We had our first appoint not too long ago but I really loved how comfortable they made my 7 year old feel, she was pretty nervous! The office was fun and all the employees were super fun and sweet. Dr. Webster made the assessment and decided to put a space maintainer in her mouth for now and come back in a few months. I was thankful that they didn't just try to throw braces in there and go crazy when she wasn't ready. Very honest and open consultation and we are happy to say this will be our orthodontic home! Thanks for welcoming us with big open arms!

Although i have passed from this street several times, i haven't noticed this restaurant before, found it when i was looking for my MealPal lunch. It is decorated very nicely, best decorated Vietnamese restaurant i have ever seen, very cozy. Service was very fast and kind. I had beef pho, it was very yummy!!!

It was take out, they put noodles and cooked beef in one container, veggies in a bag(lime slices, greens, sprouts), beef broth and sauce. There were 2 types short sprouts, they were crunchy an: delicious. In a separate bag there was some red meat, i was almost gonna cook it in microwave, but magically as soon as i put beef broth on it it turned cooked!!! mixed everything and ate the whole thing, it was such a treat!!!

The pizza was excellent, loved the flaky crust.
The staff was beyond friendly and on it with the refills. 
The dining room (or patio?) is what makes this place confusing and uncomfortable. It's Nevada in the summer. Days are 110+, it's sunny, it's hot. Why the hell would you put an open air dining room in Nevada? It's hot, it's uncomfortable, it's tiny, everyone's smashed in, and you have to wait 45 minutes for your pizza. Why? Oh but there is Mister's. MASSIVE out put misters. When inside it's like a fog, dense wet air. They do the job of cooling you down, but personally I don't like being sprayed with the garden hose while waiting for my $30 pizza.

Horrible salon. Overpriced prices, rude staff, tacky decorations, and just a bad overall feel. I hate how they mix the boutique in with the salon. The chair I had my hair done in had tacky purses hanging on them. Can I say unprofessional?! I came the first time and went to Chad and he was nothing but wonderful! Then I came back again and went to another stylist (since Chad was booked) but she acted like she was better than everyone and gave me striped (unwanted) highlights at the cost of $300. I explained I didn't like the way she did them and she replied "I don't have time, I can have you come back in but I'll have to charge you." Worst experience ever! I have nothing but horrible things to say about this trashy and overpriced place!!! Also it's dusty and I saw about 3 bugs while in the salon. Never going back again and I tell everyone how this is the worst salon I've ever been to! If I could give this a negative star I would!

You can find vinyl records, action figures, any kind of collectibles, retro gaming systems, dvds racks (clearance, sale, and 2 for $5).  They also have a free reward card.  After check out you get a puzzle piece and they donate to your choice charity.  This place stands out from anystore I've been to.  I love this place and the staff is friendly.

I've eaten here twice now courtesy of my dad.  I live in LA and we have lots of great Chinese food available to us, so our standards are a bit higher than most.  From the sound of the name,  you wouldn't think much of Asian Cafe Express.  However, they do a very nice job of putting out some authentic Cantonese food.  The taste and flavors of their dishes are not exactly what we have come to like, but everyplace has there variances according to the cook.  Still, both times we have come with 6 or 7 seven people and have ordered enough food for double that.  Both times, the food was very consistent and I have no complaints about anything.  The girls there work hard and are pretty quick considering only 2 of them handle the whole restaurant.  Prices here are very reasonable, even for Chinese food.

This was my first visit here. It was awesome! I came in a party of 5, we shared three pizzas and each were delicious. The staff was attentive and friendly and the manager stopped by each table to check on everything. I will definitely be back!

Hey hey my Az peeps Analynn here, hubby and I went to Old Chicago today had jerk rub chicken wings and we each had a salad ... spinach , chicken, avocado salad and hubby had Chicago chopped salad .  The experience from beginning to end was excellent . Our waiter Adam was on his game the entire time . Prices were very affordable . If your into football then this is the place to be with the gang during football season !!! So get your game face on and head on out to "Old Chicago" especially if you're a Bronco fan
I no longer have the receipt, I am not wanting anything in return but wanted you to know it wasn't great and to work on the service.

Good Customer Service, nice people. I like Rachel. When i Went Friday, she welcomed me with a good greetings and great smile. Apparently had problem with the shake we bought night before that. She fixed it for me and gave me another shake. The best shake in town. We will keep coming back me and my family.

Best arcade games in the valley! The staff is also super cool and really friendly. Super fun games to play for free and they hold game tournaments as well sometimes too which are loads of fun! 

Also, Chaco tacos. Any other bars sell them? Yea didn't think so.

We had the great pleasure of dining at this restaurant today. The food was absolutely amazing.  
I had the chicken shawarma! Delicious! The plate was large and had lots to take home. I loved that they give you suggestions of the best value. 
The seasoning was superb.  The restaurant was clean. (restrooms too) 
Staff was very friendly seems like they enjoyed being at work. 
The owner came around to all the tables to check on everyone and If I dare say, his beard was perfectly manicured. 
We will be back for sure. Highly recommend!

Beef kebabs were very delicious!!! $9.99 for 2 long kebabs, basmati rice with safran, salad and barbeque tomato was a great deal, we bought it as take outs, it is amazing quality and quantity for the price!!! will definitely go there often when i crave this type of food.

I have been here at least 3 times in last 6 months and have always enjoyed the food. The service is unparalleled and the carefully selected menu makes it easy. The dessert options are the best ..i almost come here to savor them..but today (07/25/17) its been a disaster ..the AC wasn't running and the food took forever.. By the way it was 90F outside.. Im sure u didnt learn tat ur AC wasn't working minutes before u started seating people. U barely had enough fans to place it around for ventilation.. worst case u had outdoor seating tat wasn't baking at 110F ..but u had no outdoor service ..i had to run out of the restaurant without enjoying my desserts becoz i was worried that  by the time it reaches the table it wuld melted away.. and my colleagues where kinda a running out of breath ..there is no excuse to wat happened today considering the price we pay ..u shuld have handled this better .. hope u wuld for the sake of the food u guys serve..
Very spacious room, clean, and neat. Good breakfast. Free parking.

Both of my children have attended Global Minds.  What an amazing school.  The school really puts the kids first.  The teachers are extremely nice and show they really care for all of the kids.  The owner/director is a super nice guy and very approachable.  He is very into making sure the kids are well taken care of.  Highly recommend this school.
First time here and it was amazing ! Highly recommend the blue crab and avocado salad and the ceviches. Just fantastic and I will definitely go back.

Based on all of the great reviews, a friend and I went to Preston's happy hour and it did not disappoint!   The server (Christopher?) was awesome, the food was great ( we had the pork wings and the prime rib sandwich) and the happy hour prices were quit reasonable.  A great find!  We'll be back for another happy hour and want to try them for dinner.

Had a mix between Thai, Swedish, and stretching massage. It was different but was very relaxing and felt great. We called the day before and got a morning appointment. The lady on the phone was super friendly and that friendliness continued when we arrived. It was inexpensive for a 1 hour massage and I would definitely go back again.

Allegiant is a low cost airline.  That being said, I have nothing but good things to say about they're customer service.  We had extenuating circumstances that affected our travel.  Allegiant went out of their way to work with us to come up with alternative plans.  They were generous to us when they didn't have to be.  They were kind and considerate of the situation.  They were great.
These guys are amazing, if you are looking for a new insurance company look no further you found the best.

Payed way more than the job was worth. The guy who did my nails was rude, rushed and insulting. They didn't look very good so I decided to get them removed less than a week later and the process was so painful. I've had acrylics removed 2 days later and it was nothing close to this pain. The skin under my nails was bruised and sore for over a week. My cousin got hers done the same day with a lady and she was getting a manicure & nails painted. Her nails were cut even though she asked to file and try to Keep as much length. Besides her fingers being mangled she returned the next day because the nail polish started to chip. Rather drive the additional 20 minutes to the old salon I went to before trying this closer one ever again.

Very clean and the staff is always nice. Also they have a great selection of color and have never once said they don't have a certain color. I come here with my friend and we always leave happy. They do amazing manicures and pedicures.

Everything about this place leaves a lot to be desired.

Cheese options on the salad bar were cubes of cheddar or pepper jack. The rest of the salad bar was equally disappointing. 

The Feijouda was black beans in extra water. Zero seasoning or meat was evident. They also did not have any faroafa to accompany the Feijouda.

The caprinias were meh and the meat was surprisingly bad. Poor cuts of meat with little care given to their preparation. The selection was also meager as I only saw tri tip, sirloin, lamb and chicken wings. 

Service was relatively poor, I was able to run out of meat several times. The frequency or the servers circulating was spotty at best, and they tended to skip tables. 

Even with coupons or Groupon discounts, this place is not worth it.

Came into Hussongs Cantina for a networking event auth Danny Vegas. The place was hopping! How fortunate the event was on Taco Tuesday. $3 tacos! 

Drinks were flowing and the crowd was happy and well served with the influx of the small business networking crowd. The wait wasn't long for drinks or food. 

I tried one each of the carnitas, barbacoa and chicken taco. Loved the pickled onions and the guac on the side. The guac had big chunks of avocado and tons of flavor. Spicy! 

Big kudos to the bartender, Elizabeth, and the manager, Fabian. They were on point and really went the extra mile to serve. Gracias!
I love this smoke shop! Super friendly employees- shout out to Pablo! Thank you so much! Can't beat the selection and they will match competitors pricing! This is my new go to smoke shop.
Dr. Misty is absolutely fabulous! She is extremely knowledgeable and makes you feel fantastic and comfortable! Always walk out of her office with a spring in my step!
The food was not that good especially for the price. We took two plates of sushis. You can get way better sushis elsewhere. The service was good.
I bring my Mini Schnauzers to get groomed and they always do a fantastic job! Great Place I recommend it to all my friends.

First of all the food is always excellent and a good value for the amount of food you get. But my visit today july 25 was a disappointment,  not for the food , but the service,  and my waitress peggy. We was seated my two young boys and i, in the old part of the diner.  Took forever to get waited on, drinks included.  Peggy finely took our order. 3 hoagies, one steak ,two Italian.  The steak hoagie came first,  we noticed no ranch dressing according to what was on the menu, after waiting forever for peggy to come back. We mentioned no ranch dressing,  she acted surprised,  and sounded like it was a burden to get him the ranch dressing.  She brought it, finally. 15 minutes later the rest of our food came out . I instructed my son to wait until all the food showed up.the food was delicious, as usual  but other customers were asking were the waitress peggy was. I asked for the bill, peggy gave it to me, went to the register. I was told only peggy could ring me up. 10 minutes later no peggy,  I said I needed to pay the bill now, I had my teenage boys waiting in the car. Was it Peggy s first day on the job? I noticed all the other waitresses was fast and efficient.  My low tip reflected my disappointment on the poor service,  not the food..

Moved into shade about two months ago and couldn't be happier with the staff and the complex. 3 weeks in my AC unit went out, after office hours. Within 25 minutes they and a new unit in my ceiling. Top notch customer service and top notch apartment for the price. I would recommend this place to anyone looking for a new apartment complex to live in.

Today I had the opportunity to have my first facial at dolce. My experience was fabulous. Not only did my esthetician listen to my specific needs, she made sure I was comfortable and relaxed. 
To top it off, I experienced a COMPLIMENTARY  blow out and style after. And, that too was great
!
I left Dolce feeling like a million bucks. Definitely what this mom of 2 under 2 needed!

I moved to Phoenix from Los Angeles and found out this place was very professional and creative which I personally enjoyed. Tommy was my barber and i continue to return. I've only been here twice and plan on coming until I don't reside here but I recommend to attend! Plus he gave me a discount for it being my first time. I haven't tried the other barbers but I'm sure they're like Tommy professional and great at what they do!

Getting into an accident is always a drag, Thi and Las Vegas Auto Body made the experience painless.  She took care of business from the get go, I had my car back in the time they promised me and she updated me every step of the way.  If you need any auto body work, I would highly recommend Las Vegas Auto Body, I have dealt with other companies and these guys are the best!!
Just passed the psychedelic art installation in the desert. Can't remember how many times we said ETC! And to think that someone got paid 3 million dollars for THIS?

Our Silky terrier Newby has been groomed by Nicole for 2+ years now. She has always done a fantastic job with him, not to mention, she has a genuine caring attitude. As evidenced by Newby's grooming session today, he looks great. I would not entrust him with anyone else!

Worst car wash ever....scammers too. I drive up and they notice i have veteran licence plates. The glass repair employee will not take no for an answer. Im already struggling taking 3 toddlers and a stroller out of my van i eventually tell him yes but I'd like to speak to my insurance first. I walk in with my ticket to pay and i go ahead and tell the cashier to tell the man I'm not interested. She goes to tell him and he walks in to yell at me that he already completed the job. Um, i told you i wanted to talk to my insurance first....he was literally harassing me about this. 

Second, way overpriced for the quality of wash you get. I have a van and understand larger cars are extra. I don't mind paying the $$ for a quality job. But everytime they get done with my van i have to wipe my car down more, vacuum more or point out places they missed. Then they get pissed at me. 

Will not be back again
Was in town and stopped here for lunch. Good food, clean, great service.

Came here a few times and will continue to come. They have great service, very polite and friendly. The food is delicious and we got complimentary donuts. My favorite place to go out and eat and have a nice dinner. It's very clean and it has a great calm atmosphere.
I heart pizza like seriously bad... and fired pie is my favorite place... the young people that work here are also amazing..

No one was rude and it seemed like a nice place but I've been here twice now walking out with zip, nothing, nada. If you work at a makeup'ish store then you should know a little something about the products your selling. I asked for a product that would give my skin a dewy look and no one could give a recommendation. I got 3, "I don't know" answers today. After asking person #2, I was told to wait for someone who might know but again after waiting 10 mins standing there like an idiot I got another IDK. I mean pulling something out of your a** is better than I don't know. I'm disappointed with the lack of product knowledge and customer service.
Food is amazing! Generous portions at an excellent price. The staff is friendly and welcoming. Lunch specials are SO good!!!

Its the summer time and i wanted to take my kids out here for a Magical event.   Right off the bat this place was very entertaining to the crowd and really got everybody excited.  Any seat in this place has a great view and the stage is so big that you're not missing any breath taking scenes.  The mixture of these majestic horses, acrobats, music and singers was Perfect Harmony!!! It was definitely a great experience to go there with my family and my kids really enjoyed it.  The show runs for 1 hour 30 min intermission and then another hour to top it off.  
One thing to know if you go there no taking photos i seen a lot of get in trounle with the ushers when taking photos.  Undeestandable they want the random flash photography distract a horse but ppl are more courtesy to take photos with flash but even that usnt allowed.  They have spotters on top amd they will catch you.  I feel it should be a good thing for ppl to take photo's.  These photos will be shared in the social media and this will gain more positive exposure for the company which will increase tickets sales.
One thing to know is that they charge $15 prepaid parking or pay there at $25 parking.  Its a load of crock i live in Mississauga and the Hershey center has more then enough free parking to accomodate patrons. Dont get scared by the tow your car signs made by the establishment they dont jave the ability ti ticket nor tow your vechicle.

Is the $140 ticket justified.  Yes given this is a a huge production and entry fee has to cover all these expenses.  

You have the pleasure to go have a great tike and take it all in ENJOY!!!!

Fantastic restaurant. Ambience, food and service. As the name suggests it looks like a beautiful garden! 
Not too count the delicious and unique flower pot chocolate cake desert. Truly a work of art. Will be back over and over!

Just went there early this week. They have a very poor selection. My eldest (3) was looking at and touching the candies that they put RIGHT at child's eye level and reach. I was in the process of getting her to put them back. An employee came and hovered over us. It was rude. Why do you put candy - an obvious temptation for a child - right in their reach? Illogical. And they put these notices around the candy that sampling is forbidden and that you will be prosecuted if you're caught sampling. A piece of advice - MOVE THE CANDY OUT OF CHILD'S REACH! COMMON SENSE! Then I asked about the pita bread. They told me that it's fresh when it obviously was not. They bring it in from California frozen. That's not fresh. Poor meat selection. Won't go back again.
Excellent service from Greg and his team. Highly recommended.

Late night dinner and they made everything fresh for us.  We waited 12 mins but totally worth it when feeding a hungry family of five!  Definitely one of the best Popeyes we've been to.  We'll be back!
Love Love this place ... The best Margaritas .... Josh bartender. Jeremy management . A must visit!!!!

The first time I went here I got really fast service.  However, i did not go on a Sunday or during brunch time so I am unable to speak on behalf of those times.  I got the nachos and they we're GINORMOUS.  I expected the serving size to be much smaller than it actually was and I would recommend that order for two to four people to eat depending on how hungry you are. The pricing wasn't too bad and the atmosphere gave off a modern, but comfortable vibe.  I think next time I go there I will try the well known chicken and a donut from there!
It's cool but there was one crazy lady working the line that ruined it all. She scolded my daughter for touching the rope. Cool ride but bad customer service. See picture.

They can't get it right!!! Second time in a row I've ordered with this location and they screwed up again!
Just want dressing for my salad! First time no dressing this time wrong dressing! Good pizza but ...

Spent $33 on pizza here tonight. First and last time I will visit. 
Ordered via phone, order repeated to me via same phone call. Paid via credit card over phone. 
Picked up pizzas, service great in-store. 

Got home, there is pepperoni/ham meat item all over one of the pizzas. The entire thing. 
As a strict vegetarian, this was not ok. 

Called the store, they told me I could come back for a new one. I said No, I would like a refund. My children are getting ready for bed and I don't have more time tonight. I asked for a refund again, to which I was told no again. He said I could come back next time for a pizza on them. I said I wouldn't be coming back after being denied twice for a refund. He asked a manager who said no refunds given. Really? 

I'm a vegetarian who just paid for a pizza my family cannot eat, and it's in the garbage. 

Giving no refunds for guest issues is terrible business practice, and I won't be supporting a company that doesn't take care of their guests for situations like this. Totally turned off.

I recently flew round trip for the first time with Spirit.My flight was on time both ways and l had my boarding passes pre printed so l didn't have to pay for that. Our checked luggage was prepaid so the cost or them wasn't to bad in my opinion. The seats weren't spacious but l didn't feel cramped, I'm 5'7". Overall, l have no complaints and I'd be willing to fly with them again. We even had extra carry ons (2 per person) on our way back home (souvenirs) that we didn't get charged for. All the staff members we encountered were friendly. Hopefully this experience was not a one time incident.
Do not do there, the girls lie and rip you off for a $100 lap dance you didn't even ask for.  DO NOT GO THERE

nice decor, owner thinks that I was talking shit about them in Chinese , and the owner (sammy) told me to fuck back off to china.

but im not from china.

would not recommend.

-inspired by Kitchen Nightmares.

After reading through the reviews this place ended up being such a disappointment. I ordered the Pho Ga to go and the moment I stepped into the restaurant all I could smell was cigarette. It smelled like an old run down bar. It was incredibly unappetizing but still since I had ordered it to go I figured the actual meal might be worth it. Not exactly. To start, all the add ins (sprouts, jalapeños, limes) were all old and dusky. The chicken smelled and tasted sour so I didn't add it into my Pho. The noodles were about the only appetizing thing and the broth was ok, but nothing I would go back again for.

OMG. We love island food, and this was the best ever - ridiculously good and served in ridiculously gigantic portions. My bowl of roast pork loco moco (a special) could have been breakfast, lunch, and dinner for me. So good! Everyone in our group of four loved the food. This is the place! (The guava cake looks astoundingly good but needless to say, we didn't have room.)

Nice little nail salon. They just open but so far it seems clean and friendly. They weren't too busy so no wait which is really nice, and since they just open last Thursday everything is brand new. The pedi chairs are really nice too, and the massage after the pedi was awesome! They are offering 15% off for their opening so that's a bonus!

Big fan of this place. Love the lunch special and the poke bowls.  Super friendly staff, open late, and the prices are very reasonable. 

Highly recommended. Better for smaller groups as they don't have any large tables.

Went to this location the other night after a night out with friends. I loved the service from our waitress Bianca! Not only was she gorgeous, she was very friendly and handled all of our accommodations. Will definitely be back because of her!

I was there last week with my friends. Everything was great, good food, good taste, good service from our server Lemonade. We order like 6-7 menu I just love everything except the oysters just little small but aver all is ok. We will come back for sure.

Love this park! The family and I often go here to work out! They have a wonderful walking trail, softball fields, and steep stairs! The steep stairs are why we exercise there, those stairs are a killing!

The food was good, however, the service was horrid. Seriously, I've received better service from diners. The waiter, while not overtly rude, was not particularly friendly. We asked him how many tapas we should order for three people. He recommended 7-10. We weren't too hungry, so we ordered 5, and only one alcoholic beverage. He wasn't happy. He said, "Well, that's a start," and left us with a menu in case we needed to order anything else, which we would have if he had come back to our table to acknowledge our presence. Not once while we were eating did he come back to check how we were doing, if the food was okay, if we wanted more drinks, or if we wanted to order more food - which we did. He didn't even remove the dirty plates. I understand that he wasn't going to make a large tip off of our table, but this service and his attitude were really beyond the pale. We were going to order dessert, but my nephew, who wanted to leave a $1 tip, didn't feel like we should spend any more money after being treated so rudely. I normally tip 18-25%. In this case, I probably should have left $1, but I left a 15% tip because we all have bad days, and perhaps this was his. Still, I won't be returning, nor will I recommend it to any business associates.
The bacon onion burger was great. Truly a phenomenal burger masterpiece. Service was mediocre, no fresh drinks and waited way to long for checks.

Fabulous office. I have been having weird issues with my insurance company, resulting in me not having been to the dentist for a full year and now I've got several issues with my teeth. Dr. Hansen (he told me to call him Richard, what a cool guy) was the most friendly, helpful dentist I have EVER been to. I'm pretty young and have found that a lot of doctors can be very patronizing to younger patients, but not with Dr. Hansen or any of the employees I spoke to. They are, however, VERY informative and answered every question I had under the sun.

I had to drive 50 minutes to get there (I live in NC) because they're the closest provider that takes my insurance, but even when I get new insurance and can go to someone closer I will still return to this office.

Karen, Rose, and the front office guy (his name escapes me!) are the bomb, super organized AND they sorted out everything with my insurance even though there were some technical difficulties. Tiffany (she took my x-rays and did my cleaning) was incredibly knowledgeable and has a great sense of humor.

I read some negative reviews from a few years ago and got nervous before I went in, but I think that they've gotten new staff or those reviews weren't legit, because I can't believe that was the same office. I wish I could give them more than five stars, I am more than satisfied with this office and excited to have found a dentist that I don't mind going to (even if the drive sucks)!

In my lengthy and desperate search for back pain relief I found massage envy.  As far as the establishment itself goes it's the easily the most professional and relaxing massage spa I found in Vegas.  I was searching for a therapist that could relieve me of my chronic back pain (lower and mid) I've suffering from for 2 years now.  Tommie was and has been my therapist ever since I walked into her room and she said I'd notice relief after the second session and have my life back after a couple more.  She kept her word and I am back to my normal everyday activities light and strenuous.  The pain was bad enough at one point I wasn't able to walk.  If you have back pain I'd highly recommend Tommie, incredibly knowledgeable and  accommodating and most importantly some sort of miracle worker.  Thank you Massage Envy and thank you Tommie!
What a charming little store! Great selection of fresh meat and yummy pan dulce, I loaded up! Really friendly staff and decent prices.
I see Dr. Handeguand at the 35th ave and southern location. All I have to say is, if you're looking for an open minded, understanding, and fun doctor. Visit him!

Had a couple rooms and a rug done this past month. Carpets were ok but pretty wet for hours and company advertises dry in an hour. Ruined my rug. They used that blue clunky machine in one of the photos uploaded. If I didn't want any special care to the rug I woulda rented a clunky rug doctor for $20 instead I paid quite bit just for the rug to now look like old carpet, fibers no longer look new. Rug is only a few months old and only needed one traffic area cleaned but now whole rug is ruined.

So happy that I found Elba on Yelp... close to my new home and down to earth.  Elba is very personable and listened to what I wanted and nailed it.  Hubby says best haircut in years!  Very relaxed atmosphere, great conversation and tons of laughs. Would highly recommend her to anyone, one less worry - I found my gal!

I loved this place but it has been less than average lately.  I go here strictly for Taco Tuesday's.  $1.50 tacos.

First time I went here, I was amazed at how tasty the Tempura Fish Taco was.  I like how it is topped with feta cheese.  I smother my tacos with their butt burning hot sauce.  I dare try not to test the habanero sauce.

The issue is not the food.  Service, presentation, and time to get my food is what makes this 3 stars.  Their cashiers are always slow.  And the time it takes to make 2 tacos seems like eternity.  To top it off, the portions of meat in the tacos have shrank and it seems they just through everything all over the place.

I don't know what happened but this place is going down.  Hopefully it gets better soon.

I went here Sunday afternoon. The decor was nice. I love the pics and movie phrases and a lot of other stuff. The food presentation was nice. My friend ordered the gumbo which she enjoyed. Also the peel and eat shrimp. Which she didn't like. I tasted one and let me tell u it was bland. I am a Cajun/creole sauce fanatic and this was not. Bubba is turning over in his grave. I had the spinach artichoke and shrimp dip which was awful and bland. I took a few bites and they happily took it off my bill. I also had the shrimp skewers that were beautiful but bland. Service was outstanding. Hostess very nice and welcoming and waiter was very attentive. I live in L.A. and go to the one on the Santa Monica Pier. The food is better there

DUUUUDE YAAAASSS! Hot damn, I didn't care much for Vegas Strip but will gladly go back for these BOMB ASS tacos. Bring a few extra stomachs and each can wait in each taco line. Seriously these tacos are what taco dreams are made of. Blew all your money at the slots? Psssh go to Tacos el Gordo and know you are still winning ..at life! 

Food: 10/5 
Service: 3/5
Place: 3/5

Very cool restaurant my husband and I really liked the decor especially the leather couches we had the strawberry and Brie the fried chicken and ribs really good food I will be going back to try something else
This used to be the spot but now with the kitchen open I think it's cooler to sit outside! Only reason I didn't give 5 stars excellent atmosphere comfy seating I love this place!

Day: Tuesday afternoon 
Time:230pm
# of ppl: 7 (4 adults, 2 teens, 1 kid)
Price: $28.99 plus tax adults and kids over 3.
Back again? No, never! 
Tips: go for ceaser, aria or wicked spoon!

Pros: 
1. servers/employees friendly and attentive 

Cons: 
1. Price because kids don't eat much, just pizza. And I paid for two to just have 1 slice of cheese pizza. They had nothing much for kids. Go for Aria cuz kids under 12 are free! And variety and flavor was so much better. 
2. Besides from the usual crab legs that everyone goes for (which I didn't eat) the food had No flavor in any foods. It was just bland. Nothing that I wanted to say "oh this is amazing!!"
